title: Spinneys becomes first UAE retailer to transition to recycled plastic packaging, in partnership with Al Bayader International - ZAWYA
summary: Spinneys, a leading fresh food retailer in the UAE, has partnered with Al Bayader International to introduce recycled plastic packaging (rPET) across its stores. The new packaging is expected to result in 20% fewer CO2 emissions and will divert two tons of virgin PET away from landfills each year. This initiative is part of Spinneys' wider sustainability strategy, which includes a 'life cycle assessment' for all new packaging and product design.
green_innovation: TRUE. The rPET packaging reduces negative environmental externalities of human activity by using less water, energy, and fossil fuels than standard ‘virgin’ PET packaging.
business_innovation: TRUE. The rPET packaging is a new or improved product that differs significantly from Spinneys' previous packaging and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. The rPET packaging is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a process, only a product.
likely_naics_codes: ['322211 - Corrugated and Solid Fiber Box Manufacturing', '322212 - Folding Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '322213 - Setup Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '322214 - Fiber Can, Tube, Drum, and Similar Products Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE. The rPET packaging is not an example of greenwashing because it is a genuine environmentally friendly product.
